Quick search

Welcome to Plenoptisign’s documentation!¶

class plenoptisign.MainClass(data=None)¶

The MainClass is meant to store optical parameters and perform numerical image distance calculations

It is made of five Mixin classes which are laid off in separate files containing methods for distance retrieval. The main methods to compute the plenoptic geometry are self.refo() and self.tria(). The Mixin classes share the optical parameters which are initialized as seen in __init__ below.

__init__(data=None)¶

Initialize plenoptic camera parameters

Parameters:
  • data – dictionary variable containing input parameters with the following keys
  • data['pp'] – pixel pitch
  • data['fs'] – focal length of micro lens
  • data['hh'] – principal plane separation of micro lens
  • data['pm'] – micro lens pitch
  • data['dA'] – exit pupil distance
  • data['fU'] – focal length of objective lens
  • data['HH'] – principal plane spacing in objective lens
  • data['df'] – object distance
  • data['f_num'] – main lens entrance pupil diameter
  • data['a'] – iterative refocusing parameter
  • data['M'] – 1-D micro image diameter
  • data['G'] – viewpoint gap
  • data['dx'] – disparity value
Variables:
  • self.d – refocusing distance
  • self.d_p – far depth of field border in refocusing
  • self.d_m – near depth of field border in refocusing
  • self.dof – depth of field
  • self.B – baseline at entrance pupil of the main lens
  • self.phi – tilt angle of virtual camera
  • self.Z – triangulation distance
  • self.bU – main lens image distance
compute_img_dist()¶

iterative computation of main lens image distance self.bU based on focal length and focus distance

compute_mic_img_size()¶

estimate micro image size

get_results()¶

list of output variables in the following order

Returns:list(self.d, self.d_p, self.d_m, self.dof, self.B, self.phi, self.Z)
static non_inf_max(input)¶

obtain maximum value from input list without consideration of infinity

Parameters:input (list) – list of real numbers
Return max_val:maximum value excluding infinity
plt_3d(plt3d, amin, sen_dims=array([24.048, 36.072]), dep_type=False)¶

draw depth planes for Axes3D class instance based on respective provided method (refo or tria)

plt_3d_init(plt3d)¶

set initial parameters for 3D plot

plt_refo(ax, plane_th=0.5, ray_th=0.5, fontsize=11)¶

plots the distance and depth of field to a plane computationally focused based on a standard plenoptic camera

plt_tria(ax, plane_th=0.5, ray_th=0.5, fontsize=11)¶

plot distance based on disparity, baseline and virtual camera orientation in a standard plenoptic camera

refo()¶

computes the distance and depth of field of a plane that is computationally focused based on a standard plenoptic camera

tria()¶

computes depth plane distance, virtual camera orientation and baseline of a standard plenoptic camera

plenoptisign.solve_sle(A, b)¶

algebraic function solver for system of linear equations

Parameters:
  • A – \(nxn\) square matrix
  • b – \(nx1\) column vector
Returns:

return x:\(nx1\) column vector

\[(a + b)^2 &= (a + b)(a + b) \ &= a^2 + 2ab + b^2\]
